title: AI/ML Specialist-Data Governance/ Risk-Vice President

description:
We’ve developed an industry-leading approach to control development and have proven the effectiveness of the solution through a manual pilot program. Now the Team needs to scale up delivery to cope with the demands of a world-leading global financial institution, with plans to leverage Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning (AI/ML) solutions to accelerate the program.

This has created a vacancy for a dynamic, self-starter to lead the pivotal transformation of cyber and technology controls from static, “bookshelf” materials to become a critical, responsive component of the way the organization manages cyber and technology risk.

Key Responsibilities:
• Participate in the delivery and maintenance of industry leading cyber and technology controls
• Help the Team adopt AI/ML technologies to automate, accelerate and improve the preparation of industry leading cyber and technology controls
• Provide advocacy and support to the organization’s Cyber and Technology Control Owners, to facilitate their adoption of the control materials thus delivered
• Collaborate with critical partners – such as Threat/Risk Identification functions and Production Assurance Teams – to identify, normalize and integrate key performance indicators (KPIs) from the operation of deployed controls, applying AI/ML techniques to improve designs and identify failures before they occur
• Partner with leading external organizations (NIST, the Cyber Risk Institute, the Information Security Forum, etc.) to advocate for continuous improvement of the external industry control frameworks on which the internal control library depends
• Work as a tireless advocate for both the technology controls ecosystem and AI/ML, helping the organization understand the benefits of adoption.

Preferred Experience:

Industry Standards and Best Practices (Advantageous but not essential)
• Experience working with ISACA COBIT, ISO 27001/2, NIST Cybersecurity Framework, SP800-53
• Experience of Financial regulatory frameworks such as FFIEC, PCI, SOC

Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning
• Hands-on experience and solid understanding of machine learning and deep learning methods.
• 5 year industry experience in data science / applied AI/ML
• Excellent python coding skills.
• Ability to interpret business stakeholder requests and translate business problems into solvable data science problems, choose and correctly utilize appropriate methodology.

General
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to:
• Work across all levels of the organization
• Present complex technical issues and abstract security principles to business and technology partners
• Leverage common tools and technologies (PowerPoint, Confluence, SharePoint, Teams, Symphony) to maximize organizational impact
• Strong personal leadership, collaboration, bias for action and experience working within fast paced, complex and high performing Digital/Agile/Scaled Agile teams
• Strong analytical skills including solving and communicating complex problems, data analytics, measurement and reporting needed to drive continuous improvement
• 5+ years of experience in Security and /or Risk Management and / or Corporate Technology with an aptitude in application and platform security
• Preferable experience working in regulated industries,
• Preferable experience working in a matrix management model across globally diverse, virtual teams to deliver strategic initiatives and commitments, ideally leveraging product and Agile principles.
• Understanding of the external threat landscape, threat actors, adversary tactics & techniques, and industry trends.
